title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 5 ยง 50.5 - Evaluation; approval
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 5 ยง 50.5 - Evaluation; approval

State Regulations
(a) The
appropriate regional office of the department shall review proposals for
funding for export trade demonstration projects to determine whether they are
complete and meet the purposes of the new Export Trade Demonstration Project

Program, and shall forward its recommendations to the Export Trade

Committee. (b) The Export Trade

Committee shall review proposed export trade demonstration project proposals
and make recommendations to the commissioner. (c) The department shall give preference to
export trade demonstration projects which benefit businesses which: (1)
are resident in New York State; (2)
are independently owned and
operated; (3)
are not dominant in
their field; (4)
employ 500
employees or less; and
(5)
are
located in a geographic area demonstrating a need for such services. (d) The commissioner shall approve
or disapprove the proposals and so notify the applicants in writing. The
department shall enter into such contractual agreements as are appropriate or
necessary to facilitate the conduct of the Export Trade Demonstration Project

Program. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 5
ยง
50.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
